message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

The paper presents an automated approach for segmenting multiple sclerosis lesions from multi-modal brain magnetic resonance images using a deep end-to-end 2D convolutional neural network. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes multi-scale feature fusion and upsampling blocks, which are related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely categories as well. The use of convolutional neural networks also suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible category. Finally, the paper deals with medical imaging, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia).
